article.title: Burgundian
article.paragraph: Burgundiancan refer to any of the following:

list.listitem: Burgundians, an East Germanic tribe, who first appear in history in South East Europe. Later Burgundians colonised the area of Gaul that is now known as Burgundy (French Bourgogne).
The OldBurgundian language (Germanic)Burgundian language, an East Germanic language spoken by the Burgundians.

The ModernBurgundian language (Ol)Burgundian language, an Ol language also known as Bourguignon spoken in the region of Burgundy, France. The neighbouring dialect ofFrainc-Comtou dialectFranc-Comtoisis sometimes regarded as part of the Burgundian group.
Burgundian (party), a political faction in early 15th century during the Hundred Years' War.
